author: Nasiru Eneji Abdulrasheed
title: Comedian Lord Lamba Confirms Paternity with Photos of Daughter Princess Keilah Amid Queen Atang's Engagement Buzz
text:
Popular Nigerian skit maker, Lord Lamba, has taken to social media to share heartwarming photos and videos of his daughter, Princess Keilah, confirming long-standing rumors of his paternity with former Big Brother Naija (BBNaija) housemate, Queen Atang. This revelation comes in the wake of Queen's engagement announcement, sparking widespread interest and discussion among fans and followers.
Speculation about the father of Queen Atang‚Äôs child swirled for months, especially after she announced her pregnancy in late 2022. However, both parties remained tight-lipped about the situation until recently.
Lord Lamba, whose real name is Promise Kelvin Anagbogu, chose a significant moment to share the first-ever photos and videos of Princess Keilah, coinciding closely with Queen's engagement news to One King David. The shared images included the child's international passport, which lists her full name as Princess Keilah Kelvin Anagbogu, leaving no room for doubt regarding her parentage.
Rise to Fame
Promise Kelvin Anagbogu, better known by his stage name Lord Lamba, has carved a niche for himself in the Nigerian entertainment industry as a talented Instagram comedian and content creator.
Known for his humorous skits that often revolve around the theme of lying to escape or resolve difficult situations, Lamba has amassed a substantial following. His choice of stage name, which translates to "Lord or Master of Lies," reflects the unique brand of comedy he brings to his audience. Beyond his comedic endeavors, Lamba has also made a mark with engaging advert campaigns, showcasing his versatility and influence in the digital space.

author: Viy√∫ Castillo
title: Este incre√≠ble alimento mejorar√≠a tu digesti√≥n y ser√≠a capaz de eliminar las heces acumuladas sin esfuerzo en tu organismo
text:
Este incre√≠ble alimento mejorar√≠a tu digesti√≥n y ser√≠a capaz de eliminar las heces acumuladas sin esfuerzo en tu organismo
Una dieta adecuada disminuye el riesgo de enfermedades como la diabetes tipo 2 y afecciones cardiovasculares, por lo que mantener una alimentaci√≥n equilibrada es clave para la salud.
Mantener una alimentaci√≥n equilibrada es esencial para conservar un buen estado de salud. Seg√∫n el periodista Ra√∫l Gonz√°lez P√©rez, seguir una dieta sana no solo permite preservar un peso adecuado, sino que tambi√©n disminuye el riesgo de enfermedades como la diabetes tipo 2, hipertensi√≥n, colesterol elevado y afecciones cardiovasculares.
En este contexto, las frutas juegan un papel clave. Su aporte de vitaminas y minerales es vital para preservar la salud, y su alto contenido de fibra junto con su bajo contenido cal√≥rico las convierte en una excelente opci√≥n dentro de una dieta balanceada.
PUEDES VER:
[Este es el superalimento que ayuda a prevenir la diabetes, combate el estre√±imiento y lo puedes consumir en un delicioso jugo]
¬øQu√© alimento podr√≠a mejorar tu digesti√≥n y eliminar los desechos acumulados?
De entre todas las frutas, una en particular sobresale por sus propiedades antioxidantes, su alto contenido de vitaminas y su capacidad para desintoxicar el organismo: la mandarina. Similar a la naranja, pero m√°s peque√±a y esf√©rica, esta fruta se distingue por su pulpa jugosa y dulce dividida en 10-12 gajos.
Su c√°scara, adem√°s de ser f√°cil de pelar, es rica en fibra diet√©tica, lo que la convierte en un elemento importante en la mejora de la digesti√≥n, seg√∫n un estudio de la Universidad Central de Venezuela publicado por 'El Universal'.
¬øC√≥mo eliminar los desechos acumulados en el cuerpo sin esfuerzo?
Para limpiar el organismo y facilitar la eliminaci√≥n de los desechos, una opci√≥n efectiva es consumir la c√°scara de mandarina. Esta, rica en fibra diet√©tica y flavonoides, puede prepararse en una infusi√≥n. Seg√∫n lo detallado por 'El Economista', al combinarla con canela, se potenciaban sus beneficios, ya que la canela tambi√©n favorece la digesti√≥n gracias a sus enzimas. Esta bebida es f√°cil de preparar y ofrece un apoyo significativo a la salud digestiva y general del cuerpo.
PUEDES VER:
[Este es el superalimento que deber√≠as incluir en tus noches para mejorar tu descanso y dormir profundamente]
Beneficios de este alimento para la digesti√≥n
Diversos estudios, como los de Tua Sa√∫de, destacan los siguientes beneficios de la mandarina:
- Disminuye el colesterol malo: La fibra presente en la mandarina ayuda a reducir el colesterol total y el colesterol LDL (colesterol malo) en la sangre.
- Previene enfermedades card√≠acas: Contiene fibra, como la pectina, que impide la absorci√≥n excesiva de grasas y contribuye a la prevenci√≥n de afecciones del coraz√≥n.
- Promueve la p√©rdida de peso: Gracias a su
bajo √≠ndice gluc√©micoy alto contenido de fibra, aumenta la saciedad y prolonga el tiempo de digesti√≥n de los alimentos. - Previene la diabetes: Su bajo √≠ndice gluc√©mico ayuda a regular los niveles de az√∫car en la sangre, lo cual es beneficioso para quienes buscan controlar la diabetes.
- Mantiene la salud de la piel: Es una fuente rica en
vitamina Cyantioxidantes, que ayudan a combatir el da√±o causado por los radicales libres y a mantener una piel saludable. - Controla la presi√≥n arterial: Gracias a su alto contenido de potasio, la mandarina favorece la eliminaci√≥n del exceso de sodio en el organismo, contribuyendo a regular la presi√≥n arterial.

author: LA NACION
title: Un escandaloso final en Gimnasia vs. Barracas Central: la enorme gresca entre ambos equipos - LA NACION
text:
Gimnasia de La Plata elimin√≥ a Barracas Central de la Copa Argentina al imponerse por 1-0 y avanz√≥ a los cuartos de final en un partido que tuvo un final escandaloso . Corridas, insultos, pu√±etazos, empujones y patadas voladoras fueron parte de las escenas dantescas que protagonizaron jugadores de ambos equipos y personas que parec√≠an allegados. Cuando todo era emoci√≥n por la despedida de Benjam√≠n Dom√≠nguez, que marc√≥ el gol y se fue de la cancha llorando porque deja el club en el que creci√≥ para sumarse, a los 20 a√±os al Bologna de Italia, el pitazo final dio paso a una batalla campal. De pronto se vio una agresi√≥n de Jhonatan Candia, del Guapo, a Yonathan Cabral , del Lobo, y por m√°s de dos minutos se sucedieron escenas que, cuando parec√≠a que todo se hab√≠a calmado, se extendieron despu√©s de retirarse los equipos del campo de juego con los hinchas.
TODOS CONTRA CANTO
El defensor de Gimnasia baj√≥ a Candia en el final del partido y varios jugadores de Barracas Central fueron en busca de venganza. ¬°NADIE PUDO BAJARLO! pic.twitter.com/45gnTadsAZ
‚Äî TyC Sports (@TyCSports) August 22, 2024 De pronto, en un abrir y cerrar de ojos, el campo de juego del estadio Ciudad de Lan√∫s se llen√≥ de gente que corr√≠a, se peleaba, trataba de separar. Hab√≠a m√°s pi√±as que calma, mientras el √°rbitro Dar√≠o Herrera lanzaba tarjetas rojas al aire sin que se llegara a advertir para qui√©nes eran. Todo desbordado. Ya imparable.
Antes del final, con Barracas Central lanzado al ataque para lograr el empate, Cabral hab√≠a golpeado a Candia en el borde del √°rea en un intento por despejar en el que su pierna sigui√≥ de largo y dio en la espalda del delantero, pero el juez no advirti√≥ esa situaci√≥n: era un peligroso tiro libre. Esta vez, con el conjunto del presidente de la AFA, Claudio ‚ÄúChiqui‚Äù Tapia, perjudicado. Tras el pitazo, el jugador del Guapo decidi√≥ cobrarse desquite por mano propia. Y all√≠ fue donde se desbord√≥ todo, con el arquero Marcos Ledesma sum√°ndose a la pelea y Candia recibiendo un golpe de atr√°s de Gustavo Cant√≥, uno de los suplentes.
üî•¬°FINAL A LAS PI√ëAS ENTRE EL LOBO Y BARRACAS CENTRAL!üí•
Consumado el triunfo de #Gimnasia , jugadores de ambos equipos se cruzaron a golpes dentro del campo de juego. #CopaArgentinaEnTyCSports pic.twitter.com/iojURBKq7P
‚Äî TyC Sports (@TyCSports) August 22, 2024 Enseguida, los jugadores de Barracas comenzaron a perseguir al futbolista del Lobo, que estaba de zapatillas y pantalones largos, y se sucedieron nuevas patadas, pi√±as lanzadas que no llegaron a destino y una trompada que s√≠ le dio en el rostro, mientras aparec√≠an integrantes del cuerpo t√©cnico, entre otros, para interceder. Incluso, vol√≥ parte del cartel de publicidad, el que se utiliza para las notas con los jugadores luego del partido. Y entonces, las cosas se pusieron peor. Un bochorno.
En un juego en el que hab√≠a sido la figura Marcelo Mi√±o, el arquero de Barracas Central, el resultado ajustado elev√≥ la tensi√≥n. Uno intentaba estirar la diferencia; el otro, llegar a la igualdad que llevara el duelo a los penales. Y tom√≥ m√°s temperatura cuando Juan Cortazzo, que hab√≠a ingresado siete minutos antes, fue expulsado por una plancha en el tiempo de descuento. El Lobo qued√≥ con 10 para un desenlace picante.
CABRAL Y CANDIA, A LAS PI√ëASü•ä #CopaArgentinaEnTyCSports . pic.twitter.com/fkRMmoR9mZ
‚Äî TyC Sports (@TyCSports) August 22, 2024 Los entrenadores intentaron frenar el accionar violento, pero cuando todo parec√≠a calmarse, volv√≠an a aparecer las peleas en varios sectores. En un momento, incluso, algunos que hab√≠an ido hacia el t√∫nel que lleva a los vestuarios volvieron al campo de juego. Y se lo vio a Cabral, por ejemplo, otra vez desbordado y a las corridas. Ambos equipos estar√°n pendientes del informe de Herrera, el √°rbitro, aunque el Lobo en mayor medida: las sanciones que haya se cumplir√°n en la Copa Argentina, salvo que el Tribunal de Disciplina decida una pena mayor.
El llanto de Benjam√≠n Dom√≠nguez por el gol de Gimnasia de La Plata ante Barracas Central, por la Copa Argentina; el delantero deja el club y viaja a Italia para unirse a Bologna. Fotobaires

author: MikeRivero
title: The Jewish establishments blindness to Palestinian slaughter also hurts U.S. Jews
text:
Jodi Rudoren of the Jewish Forward newspaper spent days reporting in Israel recently, and on December 20, Brian Lehrer of WNYC radio
asked her what Israelis think of the death toll in Gaza, which Lehrer said is ‚Äúunprecedented anywhere on earth in this century in this short a time.‚Äù
The Israelis don‚Äôt care, Rudoren said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs really not an active debate in Israel, among Jews anyway.‚Äù They are mourning and fearful, she said‚Äì then went on to rationalize the 20,000 killed. The death toll ‚Äúis totally staggering and hard to grapple with‚Ä¶ [but] we do need to keep in mind, that the international laws of war are not based on what the total death toll is, they‚Äôre based on the proportionality of the civilian casualties and collateral damage of each attack, and it takes a long time to figure that out in the fog of war.‚Äù
And therefore, ‚Äúit‚Äôs on the international community to pressure the Palestinians and the Arab world to provide some [diplomatic] alternatives that might work for Israel right now.‚Äù

author: Shannon
title: Japan‚Äôs 2 Trillion Yen AI Stimulus
text: It is no secret that Japan has lost ground in the artificial intelligence (AI) and semiconductor markets over the last five years. The COVID-19 pandemic convulsed Japanese production lines and supply chains, leaving innovation hubs and industrial complexes heavily reliant on offshore resources to fulfill demand, both for domestic consumption and for exports. To revive its next-gen tech capabilities, the Japanese government plans to roll out a 2 trillion yen ($12.8 billion) stimulus package incentivizing investors to ramp up funding in the semiconductor and AI industries. The package, to be released by the end of November, shows Japan‚Äôs strategic preference for large-scale policy support from the government to advance economic goals. This is not an out-of-the-box policy decision taken by the government of Japan after Ishiba Shigeru becameprime minister. Over the last three years, the government under former Prime Minister Kishida Fumio provided more than 0.71 percent of GDP or around 4 trillion yen for the same cause. The continual efforts to rebuild Japan‚Äôs strength in AI and chip markets shows the Liberal Democratic Party‚Äôs determination to stand firm in domestic capacity building. Japan‚Äôs Tech Ambitions Japan‚Äôs technological policies are aiming for a comprehensive AI rollout, complete with domestic AI-enabled chips that break through the 5nm barrier. The hope is that these tech advances will stimulate transformative economic and social progress. It is the need of the hour, as Japan is on the verge of digitalizing its economy, health services, and disaster responses. As per a GLOCOM study, Generative AI (Gen-AI) can unlock 148.7 trillion yen of productive capacity in Japan, equivalent to over one-fifth of Japan‚Äôs current GDP. This stands to be the most benefit any single country is expected to materialize in the next-gen tech segment. With this clear benefit in mind, Japan is pushing more subsidized finances into its AI and chips markets to regain its strategic tech autonomy in the region, and even extend its reach to major emerging markets. AI market forecasts add another incentive behind this mega-stimulus package. Japan‚Äôs AI market size is expected to reach $27.12 billion by 2032 ‚Äì the fastest growth in the forecast period of 2022-2032. Japan‚Äôs AI market will experience a compound annual growth rate of 21.43 percent over this period. The upcoming stimulus is a dual solution package for the country: It strengthens the Japanese AI and chip industries, providing a new driver of economic growth, while also addressing issues of aging and a reduced workforce. This is one of the basic building blocks of Society 5.0, Japan‚Äôs vision for ‚Äúa human-centered society in which economic development and the resolution of social issues are compatible with each other through a highly integrated system of cyberspace and physical space.‚Äù The Stimulus Package In earlier packages, the Japanese government focused on long-term support measures and capacity generation for the chip and AI industries ‚Äì an approach that did not help Japan immediately gain access to global markets. The next stimulus is going to address medium-term support measures, like issuing new bridging bonds having government shares and fixed mid-term treasury notes with higher rates of interest. Reportedly, the Bank of Japan will also use Japanese government bonds as fixed income instruments to support AI and semiconductor investments by corporations, agencies, and foreign companies. In parallel, government-owned companies like Nippon Telegraph, Japan Tobacco, and Telephone Corporation will reward investors‚Äô shares through their dividends ‚Äì an additional layer of financial guarantee provided by the government of Japan to tech investors. Understanding the urgent needs of Japan‚Äôs next-gen tech ecosystem, the government will also provide upfront investment support to semiconductor companies that will establish new production facilities inside Japan. The investments will be supported by the government continuously, even if the private sector backs out of the designated projects. This package guarantees financial backing to investors until the project is established on the ground. Analyzing the recent next-gen tech stimulus packages rolled out by the Japanese government, it is clear that the footprint of tech production facilities continues to expand. Until September 2024, Hokkaido seemed to be the new future tech center of Japan. But the recent expansion of private tech investments by technology majors in other areas ‚Äì like Panasonic in Wakayama, TSMC in Kumamoto, Rapidus in Chiyoda, and Kioxia in Yokkaichi ‚Äì made it clear that regional diversification is also high on Japan‚Äôs agenda, keeping future offshore threats in mind. Japan‚Äôs Economic Security Promotion Act, 2022 highlighted a stable semiconductor supply chain and a thriving domestic chip industry as urgent national tasks. To achieve this, it advised onshoring and offshoring efforts under a public-private partnership model. The upcoming stimulus package is another step on the same path toward subsidizing companies to relocate their production hubs domestically. Meanwhile, it‚Äôs hoped that Japanese firms‚Äô overseas supply chain will expand production facilities across Southeast Asia and South Asia to cater to regional production markets. This will open new avenues for Japanese production hubs to expand their footprints, benefiting dual markets through singular tech advancements within a company. The role of Japanese government-backed Rapidus, a coalition of eight major Japanese companies, is critical in this stimulus package. Rapidus is mandated to cement Japan‚Äôs semiconductor and AI landscape through strategic initiatives. The package will attract its coalition partners to reach a series of goals: to produce 2nm AI-enabled chips by 2027, establish a fully automated chip production facility by 2028, train 20,000-plus engineers in cutting-edge semiconductor designing, and bypass tech hurdles by adopting new architectures like Gate-All-Around (GAA) transistors instead of traditional FinFET designs. To that end, Rapidus needs to identify new advanced startups to pivot Japan‚Äôs AI and chip journey to a fruitful end. These packages can establish Japan as a leader in next-stage AI, both at the development and deployment fronts. Domestic Hurdles It is noteworthy that the Japanese AI market is experiencing a surge in the adoption of AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants, as companies look to improve their customer service and try to streamline their regular operations. But, in parallel, it is also true that efforts by Japanese governments to digitalize services have been unpopular with the Japanese public, an attitude only exacerbated by issues with the ‚ÄúMy Number‚Äù launch last year. The Japanese people‚Äôs skepticism toward next-gen technology and cultural emphasis on human interaction rather than AI-backed digital mediums is a hurdle in convincing tech majors to invest domestically. Another problem is risk aversion. Japanese society has an ingrained aversion to risk, which reflects in individual as well as in corporate behavior. This dynamic leads to conservatism in corporate practices, which has been a huge drag on next-gen tech advances in Japan. That said, sophisticated AI and chip fab development was a specialty of Japan until very recently, as late as the second decade of the 21st century. The various tech stimulus packages seek to urge Japanese corporations to reclaim their leading position by embracing the entrepreneurial ecosystem of current digital landscape. While the Japanese government focuses on the expansion of next-gen tech inside the country, keiretsu groups, an interconnected network of Japanese companies, prefer to seek profits outside of the domestic market. The fresh stimulus package will try to weld the government‚Äôs aspirational policies with the sentiments of private corporations. The large-scale mid-term strategic financial support seeks to enable Japanese corporations to collaborate, cooperate, co-develop, and finally co-produce the next-gen technologies that are required for future national growth.

author: Peter Hannam
title: Queensland power supply to face strain as heatwave sends demand to near-record levels | Energy | The Guardian
text:
Queensland‚Äôs electricity supplies are expected to be strained for a second day in a row as the heatwave roasting much of northern Australia lifts power demand to near-record levels.
The mercury exceeded its forecast maximum for Brisbane of 37C by early afternoon and was recently at 38.3.5C, or eight degrees above the December average, Bureau of Meteorology data showed.
Queensland is in the midst of a multi-day heatwave, with temperatures tipped to rise into the mid-40C range in some inland places on Friday. Brisbane's maximum is forecast to reach 37C, with nearby towns nudging 40C. (Source: @bom_au ) pic.twitter.com/7jVmEO02oC
‚Äî @phannam@mastodon.green (@p_hannam) December 28, 2023 Residents have been cranking up their air-conditioning, sending electricity demand soaring to more than 9800 megawatts on Thursday evening.
According to energy website, Watt Clarity , that peak was only about 300MW shy of Queensland‚Äôs all-time peak demand.
Australia New Year‚Äôs Eve weather: risk of more storms for parts of Queensland and NSW but capitals mostly dry
Read more The chief executive of energy consultancy Global-Roam, Paul McArdle, said the demand spike was surprising given the absence of most industrial demand at this time of year.
‚ÄúRemember that this is a very ‚Äòsleepy‚Äô period where there‚Äôs not much running in terms of commercial load (other than shopping post-Christmas), and even some industrial loads would be reduced,‚Äù McArdle said.
Electricity demand in Queensland looks to have peaked yesterday at above 9800 megawatts, or not far short of the state's record of 10,119MW set in March 2020. (Sources: @AEMO_Energy , @WattClarity ) pic.twitter.com/JTgklFrFdh
‚Äî @phannam@mastodon.green (@p_hannam) December 28, 2023 Dr Dylan McConnell, an energy specialist at the University of NSW, said Thursday‚Äôs demand was ‚Äúcertainly an outlier by historical standards by quite a margin‚Äù.
Power demand was about 1327MW higher than the previous highest day during the Christmas-New Year period, set during on 31 December 2016, he said.
McConnell said one difference between Thursday and today would be a lower power demand in New South Wales. That meant it should be a ‚Äúsafer day from the electricity system perspective, but it‚Äôs still pretty incredible‚Äù to have demand running so high.
Queensland‚Äôs energy minister, Mick de Brenni, said the state‚Äôs power system ‚Äúremains secure, and available supply exceeds demand‚Äù.
‚ÄúQueenslanders have a power system with more than adequate supply because they own it, and the Miles government will keep it that way ‚Äì owned by Queenslanders,‚Äù de Brenni said.
‚ÄúDuring the ongoing hot conditions across our state, our number one concern is that Queenslanders keep safe ‚Äì this means staying out of the sun and keeping cool and well hydrated,‚Äù he said.
Meanwhile 750 Energex crews had restored power to more than 100,000 customers across the state‚Äôs southeast. About 27,400 customers were still have their power switched back on, de Brenni said.
Near the demand peak on Thursday, wholesale spot prices reached almost $15,000 a MW-hour, Australian Energy Market Operator (Aemo) data shows. That compared with an average of about $65/MWh in the most recent weekly figures released by the ASX.
According to Aemo‚Äôs data, demand on Thursday peaked at 9680MW, making it the 10th highest recorded in Queensland. The highest came in March this year, with demand reaching 10,070MW.
An Aemo spokesperson said Queensland‚Äôs demand could reach 9,900MW later on Friday, which would be the fourth-highest on record if reached.
Queensland's electricity demand reaching almost 9800MW, or close to @AEMO_Energy 's forecast high of 9900MW (which would be 4th highest ever for the state - and more than 1000MW higher than the previous high for this time of year - excluding yesterday). pic.twitter.com/AUq2z8BBf5
‚Äî @phannam@mastodon.green (@p_hannam) December 29, 2023 Queensland consumers, though, were fortunate that the increase in power demand wasn‚Äôt later in the summer, McArdle said.
‚ÄúImagine what would have happened to the demand levels had this same weather pattern hit us late in January or early February 2024 with industry and commercial industrial energy users back at work!?,‚Äù he said, adding that the state would surely set a new demand peak if it did.
New South Wales also faced strains on its grid earlier this summer.
A one-day heat spike on 14 December, combined with the Mt Piper coal-fired power station losing half its capacity of about 1400MW due to a fault, prompted the state government to appeal to consumers to reduce their energy usage to avoid blackouts.
Across northern Australia, some high 40C temperatures may be reached in the next couple of days. (Marble Bar may be among the hottest with a 10-day stint of 45C+ days possible, including 48C forecast for Saturday.) pic.twitter.com/M8v1gnToPV
‚Äî @phannam@mastodon.green (@p_hannam) December 28, 2023 Queensland‚Äôs energy supplies have also been hindered by the loss of the 66MW Barron Gorge hydro plant near Cairns, as a result of damage from cyclone Jasper and the subsequent deluge.
The heatwave in Queensland extends across much of northern Australia, with conditions expected to be severe in areas near Darwin and elsewhere in coming days, the bureau said.
Temperatures topped 40C in Queensland, NSW, South Australia, Western Australia and the Northern Territory, the bureau data showed.
Towns such as Marble Bar, in Western Australia, may reach 48C on Saturday, according to bureau forecasts.
This would be the second hottest temperature recorded anywhere in Australia in 2023, trailing only the 49.3C recorded on 14 January at Onslow Airport, also in northwest WA.
Explore more on these topics Energy Australia weather Queensland Western Australia news
Reuse this content

author: Leandro Costa Criscuolo
title: Um inimigo invis√≠vel pairando no ar pode estar associado ao c√¢ncer
text:
Pneus e lixo degradado liberam pequenos fragmentos de [pl√°stico](https://olhardigital.com.br/tag/microplastico/) no ar, criando forma de polui√ß√£o do [ar](https://olhardigital.com.br/tag/ar/) que pode estar relacionada a doen√ßas respirat√≥rias e outras condi√ß√µes graves, de acordo com novo estudo de pesquisadores da Universidade da Calif√≥rnia em S√£o Francisco, publicado na [Environmental Science & Technology](https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/acs.est.3c09524).
Uma revis√£o de cerca de tr√™s mil estudos sugere que essas part√≠culas est√£o associadas a problemas de sa√∫de, como infertilidade, c√¢ncer de c√≥lon, fun√ß√£o pulmonar prejudicada e inflama√ß√£o cr√¥nica dos pulm√µes, o que pode aumentar o risco de c√¢ncer de pulm√£o.
Micropl√°sticos: eles est√£o por toda a parte e podem causar c√¢ncer
- Os micropl√°sticos, com menos de cinco mil√≠metros, s√£o onipresentes no ambiente;
- A cada ano, quase 460 milh√µes de toneladas de pl√°stico s√£o produzidas globalmente e a previs√£o √© que esse n√∫mero alcance 1,1 bilh√£o at√© 2050;
- O desgaste de pneus durante a condu√ß√£o √© uma das principais fontes desses micropl√°sticos no ar.
Leia mais:
O novo estudo √© a primeira revis√£o sistem√°tica de micropl√°sticos com m√©todos reconhecidos pela Academia Nacional de Ci√™ncias. Embora a maioria dos estudos tenha sido realizada com animais, os pesquisadores acreditam que as conclus√µes se aplicam tamb√©m aos humanos, dada a exposi√ß√£o comum a essas part√≠culas.
O estudo foi expandido a partir de relat√≥rio anterior em colabora√ß√£o com o California State Policy Evidence Consortium (CalSPEC), que fornece evid√™ncias para formuladores de pol√≠ticas da Calif√≥rnia (EUA).
Os pesquisadores pedem que autoridades e l√≠deres pol√≠ticos considerem as crescentes evid√™ncias dos danos √† sa√∫de causados pelos micropl√°sticos e adotem medidas para reduzir a exposi√ß√£o a essas part√≠culas. ‚ÄúEsperamos que as autoridades respons√°veis tomem medidas imediatas para evitar novas exposi√ß√µes‚Äù, disse Nicholas Chartres, um dos autores do estudo.

author: Rosario3
title: El padre Ignacio celebra el V√≠a Crucis en forma online este Viernes Santo: horario y c√≥mo verlo
text: Este viernes el padre Ignacio Peries encabeza su tradicional V√≠a Crucis de forma virtual. Es el n√∫mero 45. A diferencia de otros a√±os, el sacerdote de barrio Rucci decidi√≥ realizar online la ceremonia que recuerda la muerte y resurrecci√≥n de Jes√∫s. Se trata de uno de los ritos m√°s importantes del catolicismo y que a√±o a a√±o congregaba a miles de fieles en torno a la iglesia Natividad del Se√±or. Ahora, podr√° seguirse por Rosario3, por el canal de You Tube de El Tres TV y por la se√±al de El Tres en Direct TV. Hace poco m√°s de dos semanas, el padre Ignacio hab√≠a anticipado que [esta vez el V√≠a Crucis iba a ser virtual por razones de "seguridad" y por los costos del transporte](https://www.rosario3.com/informaciongeneral/El-Via-Crucis-del-padre-Ignacio-este-ano-sera-virtual-por-la-inseguridad-y-la-crisis-economica-20240310-0014.html) para movilizarse. "No quiero que gasten, este a√±o yo voy a tu casa", dijo. As√≠, este 2024 las 14 estaciones de la Pasi√≥n de Cristo podr√°n seguirse por streaming, en Rosario3, en el canal de You Tube de El Tres TV o en la se√±al de El Tres en Direct TV. Lo importante, hab√≠a destacado Ignacio, "es poder rezar en familia".

author: Emma Misiaszek
title: chevron-right
text: Gov. Kathy Hochul Thursday announced that 1,400 households will benefit from more than $46 million in grant awards to support affordable homeownership. The grants will help low- and moderate-income families make repairs or safety upgrades to their homes, replace manufactured homes, and provide down payment assistance for first-time buyers. The grants ‚Äì administered by New York State Homes and Community Renewal‚Äôs Office of Community Renewal ‚Äì were awarded to nonprofit organizations and localities to help preserve affordable housing, support veterans and older New Yorkers, increase access to homeownership, and strengthen local economies. Central New York is the recipient of over $4 million in awards and will serve a proposed 109 units. The City of Cortland and the Village of Homer will receive $500,00 and $480,000 respectively to help with projects that improve communities and benefit their residents. Housing grants can be used for housing rehabilitation of owner-occupied or renter-occupied homes, down payment assistance for low- and moderate-income first-time homebuyers, and private water/wastewater system assistance for low- and moderate-income homeowners. Home Headquarters Inc. and Onondaga County Community Development will receive $239,200 and $150,000 respectively to make homes accessible for low- and moderate-income persons with disabilities so that they can continue living safely and comfortably in their residences or return to live in their residences instead of in an institutional setting. Cayuga County Homsite Development Corp. and Stoneleigh Housing, Inc. will receive $500,000 and $200,000 respectively to assist senior citizen homeowners with the cost of addressing emergencies and code violations that pose a threat to their health and safety or affect the livability of the home. Assistance for the cost of these critical repairs enables seniors to continue to live independently in their homes. Covenant Housing Corp. of Central New York, Community Action Program for Madison County, the City of Fulton and Cayuga County Homsite Development Corp. will receive $400,000, $429,670, $585,500 and $700,000 respectively to acquire and/or rehabilitate single-family housing, provide down payment assistance, replace dilapidated mobile and manufactured homes as well as provide tenant-based rental assistance to households with incomes at or below 80 percent of Area Median Income. ‚ÄúAs housing costs continue to rise, this significant investment will help carve out a path to affordable homeownership for 1,400 New York families,‚Äù Hochul said. ‚ÄúMy administration is using every tool at our disposal to address the state‚Äôs housing crisis, and we will continue to push forward on programs, strategies, and funding initiatives that put New Yorkers in safe, affordable homes.‚Äù

organizations.name: new york state homes and community renewal‚Äôs office of community renewal
